newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybeans end mostly down in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybeans end mostly down in slow trade.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended mostly down in slow trade on Monday on a lack of positive market-moving news, traders said.
The most active September 1997 contract fell two yuan to 3,328 yuan ($401) per tonne. It opened unchanged at an intraday high of 3,330, hitting a low of 3,320.
March fell 15 yuan to 3,080, May did not trade, July, the only rising contract, put on 11 to 3,320, November lost eight to 3,329 and the January 1998 contract five to 3,339.
Combined volume fell to 19,600 tonnes from 21,300.
"Many investors are seen liquidating their positions and turning to other more active markets, for instance the stock market," said one trader.
Analysts said they expected soybeans to fall further with trading remain thin in the next few days.
